title: Add standalone Privacy Policy page and wire footer link to /privacy

requirements.text: Create a new standalone Privacy Policy page at route `/privacy` with concise, professional Privacy Policy content appropriate for the TelsFX site, and keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: When the user click on the privacy policy it should open a new stand alone page and in that page fill in some privacy policies that you recommend for the site for me.
Yes but not too long keeping every other thing intact

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating directly to `/privacy` renders a standalone Privacy Policy page (not a modal and not embedded inside another page).
Privacy Policy content is concise (shorter than the existing Terms page) while still being professionally structured with clear section headings.
All user-facing text on the Privacy Policy page is English.
No other existing pages or routes have their layouts/content changed as part of this work (except where necessary to add the new route).

requirements.text: Wire the existing site footer "Privacy Policy" link to navigate to `/privacy` using the existing global route-transition UX (spinner + fade-in), without breaking any other footer links or existing navigation behavior.

quotes: Should the footer’s existing “Privacy Policy” link be wired to this new standalone page using the same global spinner + fade‑in transition as Terms?

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Privacy Policy" in the footer triggers the same route-transition overlay behavior used elsewhere (brief spinner, then route changes).
After the transition, the app URL is `/privacy` and the Privacy Policy page content renders.
The existing "Terms & Conditions" footer link continues to work and still navigates to `/terms` with the same transition behavior.
No footer links are left non-functional on mobile or desktop.

constraints: Keep every other part of the site intact aside from adding the new `/privacy` page and wiring the existing footer Privacy Policy link to it.
All user-facing text introduced or modified by this change must be in English.
Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not change the existing global route-transition timing/behavior beyond reusing it for the footer Privacy Policy link.
Do not add the Privacy Policy link to the public header/navigation (footer wiring only).
Do not add backend storage or APIs related to privacy policies.

preferencesToAdd: Prefer concise legal pages (Privacy Policy) while keeping the rest of the site unchanged.
